Europe.name: Albania
hints: The only European country with over 700,000 communist-era bunkers still scattered across its territory
Home to the ancient city of Butrint, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
Capital: Tirana

Europe.name: Andorra
hints: The parliament of this microstate once met in a converted chicken coop
Has the highest life expectancy in Europe (over 82 years)
Capital: Andorra la Vella

Europe.name: Austria
hints: Birthplace of Sigmund Freud and the waltz dance tradition
The world's oldest operating ferris wheel is in Vienna's Prater Park
Capital: Vienna

Europe.name: Belarus
hints: 20% of its territory consists of protected marshlands called 'Europe's Lungs'
Produces the world's largest dump trucks (BelAZ)
Capital: Minsk

Europe.name: Belgium
hints: Invented fries (though disputed by France) and has over 1,000 beer varieties
Hosts the EU and NATO headquarters
Capital: Brussels

Europe.name: Bosnia And Herzegovina
hints: The only European country with three official presidents representing different ethnic groups
Home to the ancient Stari Most bridge in Mostar
Capital: Sarajevo

Europe.name: Bulgaria
hints: The Cyrillic alphabet was developed here in the 9th century
Produces 85% of the world's rose oil
Capital: Sofia

Europe.name: Croatia
hints: Home to the world's smallest town (Hum) with a population of 30
Has a coastline with over 1,200 islands
Capital: Zagreb

Europe.name: Cyprus
hints: The only divided capital city (Nicosia) in the world
Legendary birthplace of Aphrodite according to Greek mythology
Capital: Nicosia

Europe.name: Czechia
hints: Home to the world's largest castle complex (Prague Castle)
Invented the word 'robot' (from Czech 'robota')
Capital: Prague

Europe.name: Denmark
hints: The oldest continuously used national flag (Dannebrog, since 1219)
Legoland in Billund was the first LEGO theme park
Capital: Copenhagen

Europe.name: Estonia
hints: One of the world's most digitally advanced societies (e-voting since 2005)
Has over 2,000 islands in the Baltic Sea
Capital: Tallinn

Europe.name: Finland
hints: The 'Land of a Thousand Lakes' actually has over 188,000 lakes
Home to the Santa Claus Village in Rovaniemi
Capital: Helsinki

Europe.name: France
hints: The only country with territories on five continents
The Louvre is the world's most visited art museum
Capital: Paris

Europe.name: Georgia
hints: Claims to be the birthplace of wine (8,000-year-old winemaking tradition)
The cave city of Uplistsikhe dates back to the Iron Age
Capital: Tbilisi

Europe.name: Germany
hints: Invented the printing press (Gutenberg Bible, 1455)
The Berlin Wall divided the city for 28 years
Capital: Berlin

Europe.name: Greece
hints: First host of the modern Olympic Games (1896)
Has over 6,000 islands, with only 227 inhabited
Capital: Athens

Europe.name: Hungary
hints: The Rubik's Cube was invented by a Hungarian architect
Home to Europe's largest thermal lake (Hévíz)
Capital: Budapest

Europe.name: Iceland
hints: No mosquitoes exist here due to unique climate conditions
The only place where you can swim between tectonic plates (Silfra fissure)
Capital: Reykjavik

Europe.name: Ireland
hints: Halloween originated from the ancient Celtic festival Samhain
Has the world's oldest yacht club (1720)
Capital: Dublin

Europe.name: Italy
hints: Home to the world's smallest country (Vatican City)
The Leaning Tower of Pisa took 199 years to complete
Capital: Rome

Europe.name: Kosovo
hints: The youngest European country (declared independence in 2008)
The medieval Gračanica Monastery is a UNESCO site
Capital: Pristina

Europe.name: Latvia
hints: Invented jeans (Jacob Davis, a Latvian tailor, partnered with Levi Strauss)
Riga's Central Market is housed in repurposed WWI zeppelin hangars
Capital: Riga

Europe.name: Liechtenstein
hints: The only country entirely in the Alps
You can rent the entire country for $70,000/night (2011 offer)
Capital: Vaduz

Europe.name: Lithuania
hints: Once the largest country in Europe (14th-century Grand Duchy)
Hill of Crosses has over 200,000 religious symbols
Capital: Vilnius

Europe.name: Luxembourg
hints: The world's only Grand Duchy still in existence
Has the highest minimum wage in the EU
Capital: Luxembourg City

Europe.name: Malta
hints: Maltese is the only Semitic language written in Latin script
The Megalithic Temples are older than Stonehenge
Capital: Valletta

Europe.name: Moldova
hints: Home to the world's largest wine cellar (Mileștii Mici)
The national dish is 'mămăligă' (polenta)
Capital: Chișinău

Europe.name: Monaco
hints: The world's most densely populated country
Hosts the iconic Formula 1 Grand Prix street race
Capital: Monaco

Europe.name: Montenegro
hints: Named after the 'Black Mountain' (Lovćen) dominating its landscape
The Bay of Kotor is Europe's southernmost fjord
Capital: Podgorica

Europe.name: Netherlands
hints: 30% of the country lies below sea level
First country to legalize same-sex marriage (2001)
Capital: Amsterdam

Europe.name: North Macedonia
hints: Alexander the Great's birthplace (ancient Pella)
Lake Ohrid is one of Europe's oldest lakes
Capital: Skopje

Europe.name: Norway
hints: Invented the cheese slicer in 1925
The Svalbard Global Seed Vault preserves crop diversity
Capital: Oslo

Europe.name: Poland
hints: Home to the world's largest castle by land area (Malbork Castle)
Nicolaus Copernicus first proposed heliocentrism here
Capital: Warsaw

Europe.name: Portugal
hints: The oldest country in Europe with unchanged borders since 1139
Invented tempura (via Portuguese traders in Japan)
Capital: Lisbon

Europe.name: Romania
hints: Home to Europe's heaviest building (Palace of the Parliament)
The Danube Delta hosts over 300 bird species
Capital: Bucharest

Europe.name: Russia
hints: Spans 11 time zones (the most in the world)
The Trans-Siberian Railway is the longest railway line
Capital: Moscow

Europe.name: San Marino
hints: The world's oldest surviving republic (founded 301 AD)
Has more vehicles than people
Capital: San Marino

Europe.name: Serbia
hints: Invented the first raspberry gene bank
The Exit Festival in Novi Sad is one of Europe's largest
Capital: Belgrade

Europe.name: Slovakia
hints: Home to more castles per capita than any other country
The only capital bordering two countries (Austria & Hungary)
Capital: Bratislava

Europe.name: Slovenia
hints: The only country with 'LOVE' in its name
Lake Bled's island church has a wishing bell
Capital: Ljubljana

Europe.name: Spain
hints: The only European country with physical borders in Africa
Invented the modern novel (Don Quixote, 1605)
Capital: Madrid

Europe.name: Sweden
hints: Home to the Nobel Prize ceremony
Has 267,570 islands (more than any other country)
Capital: Stockholm

Europe.name: Switzerland
hints: The only country with a square flag
Invented Velcro and the Swiss Army knife
Capital: Bern

Europe.name: Ukraine
hints: The largest country entirely within Europe
Home to the deepest metro station (Arsenalna, Kyiv)
Capital: Kyiv

Europe.name: United Kingdom
hints: The only country not required to name itself on postage stamps
The London Underground is the oldest metro system
Capital: London

Europe.name: Vatican
hints: The world's smallest country by population (around 800 citizens)
Home to Michelangelo's Sistine Chapel ceiling
Capital: Vatican City

Asia.name: Afghanistan
hints: Home to the ancient 'Silk Road' city of Balkh
National sport is buzkashi, played with a goat carcass
Capital: Kabul

Asia.name: Armenia
hints: First country to adopt Christianity as a state religion (301 AD)
Mount Ararat, a national symbol, lies in neighboring Turkey
Capital: Yerevan

Asia.name: Azerbaijan
hints: Known as the 'Land of Fire' due to natural gas flames
Home to over 400 mud volcanoes
Capital: Baku

Asia.name: Bahrain
hints: Site of the ancient Dilmun civilization
The Formula 1 Gulf Air Bahrain Grand Prix is held here
Capital: Manama

Asia.name: Bangladesh
hints: Has the world's largest river delta (Ganges-Brahmaputra)
Produces 95% of the world's jute fiber
Capital: Dhaka

Asia.name: Bhutan
hints: Measures Gross National Happiness instead of GDP
The only carbon-negative country in the world
Capital: Thimphu

Asia.name: Brunei
hints: Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah has ruled since 1967
The Istana Nurul Iman is the world's largest residential palace
Capital: Bandar Seri Begawan

Asia.name: Cambodia
hints: Home to Angkor Wat, the largest religious monument
Uses the riel, but the US dollar is widely accepted
Capital: Phnom Penh

Asia.name: China
hints: Invented paper, gunpowder, and the compass
The Great Wall is visible from space (myth debunked)
Capital: Beijing

Asia.name: East Timor
hints: One of the youngest countries (independence in 2002)
Coffee is a major export, grown in mountainous regions
Capital: Dili

Asia.name: India
hints: Birthplace of yoga and the decimal numeral system
Has the world's largest film industry (Bollywood)
Capital: New Delhi

Asia.name: Indonesia
hints: The only country with a natural habitat for Komodo dragons
Largest archipelago nation with over 17,000 islands
Capital: Jakarta

Asia.name: Iran
hints: Formerly known as Persia, home to the ancient city of Persepolis
Hosts the world's largest carpet museum
Capital: Tehran

Asia.name: Iraq
hints: Ancient Mesopotamia, where writing was invented
Holds the world's third-largest oil reserves
Capital: Baghdad

Asia.name: Israel
hints: The Dead Sea here is Earth's lowest elevation on land
Home to the tech hub 'Silicon Wadi'
Capital: Jerusalem

Asia.name: Japan
hints: Hosts the world's busiest pedestrian crossing (Shibuya)
Invented karaoke and emojis
Capital: Tokyo

Asia.name: Jordan
hints: Home to Petra, the 'Rose City' carved into cliffs
The Dead Sea borders its western edge
Capital: Amman

Asia.name: Kazakhstan
hints: Largest landlocked country in the world
Baikonur Cosmodrome launches Russian spacecraft
Capital: Nur-Sultan

Asia.name: Kuwait
hints: Currency is the highest-valued unit in the world (1 KWD ≈ 3.3 USD)
Rebuilt after the 1990 Iraqi invasion
Capital: Kuwait City

Asia.name: Kyrgyzstan
hints: Over 90% of the country is mountainous
Known for its nomadic eagle hunters
Capital: Bishkek

Asia.name: Laos
hints: Only landlocked country in Southeast Asia
The Plain of Jars has thousands of ancient stone jars
Capital: Vientiane

Asia.name: Lebanon
hints: Phoenician civilization originated here
National symbol is the cedar tree
Capital: Beirut

Asia.name: Malaysia
hints: Home to the Petronas Twin Towers (once the world's tallest)
One of only two countries with territory on mainland Asia and an island (Borneo)
Capital: Kuala Lumpur

Asia.name: Maldives
hints: Lowest country in the world (average elevation: 1.5m)
Each island is a single resort
Capital: Malé

Asia.name: Mongolia
hints: The least densely populated country in the world
Genghis Khan founded the largest contiguous empire from here
Capital: Ulaanbaatar

Asia.name: Myanmar
hints: Formerly known as Burma until 1989
Shwedagon Pagoda is covered in 27 tons of gold
Capital: Naypyidaw

Asia.name: Nepal
hints: Home to Mount Everest, the world's highest peak
Birthplace of Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)
Capital: Kathmandu

Asia.name: North Korea
hints: The Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) separates it from South Korea
Has its own calendar system (Juche era)
Capital: Pyongyang

Asia.name: Oman
hints: Once a major hub for the frankincense trade
Sultan Qaboos ruled for 50 years (1970–2020)
Capital: Muscat

Asia.name: Pakistan
hints: K2, the world's second-highest mountain, is located here
Indus Valley Civilization dates back to 3300 BCE
Capital: Islamabad

Asia.name: Palestine
hints: Recognized by the UN as a non-member observer state
The Church of the Nativity is in Bethlehem
Capital: Ramallah (administrative)

Asia.name: Philippines
hints: Archipelago of over 7,600 islands
Hosts the world's longest Christmas celebration
Capital: Manila

Asia.name: Qatar
hints: Hosted the 2022 FIFA World Cup
Richest country in the world by GDP per capita
Capital: Doha

Asia.name: Saudi Arabia
hints: Birthplace of Islam and home to Mecca
Largest oil exporter in the world
Capital: Riyadh

Asia.name: Singapore
hints: A city-state with four official languages
Chewing gum sales are banned (except medicinal)
Capital: Singapore

Asia.name: South Korea
hints: Global leader in esports and K-pop culture
Invented the modern rainy-day dish bibimbap
Capital: Seoul

Asia.name: Sri Lanka
hints: Formerly known as Ceylon (famous for tea)
Home to the ancient rock fortress Sigiriya
Capital: Colombo

Asia.name: Syria
hints: Damascus is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities
Ancient city of Palmyra is a UNESCO World Heritage Site
Capital: Damascus

Asia.name: Taiwan
hints: This island nation is home to the highest mountain in East Asia outside of the Himalayas — Yushan

Capital: Taipei

Asia.name: Tajikistan
hints: Over 90% of the country is mountainous
Pamir Highway is one of the world's highest roads
Capital: Dushanbe

Asia.name: Thailand
hints: Formerly called Siam until 1939
Home to the world’s smallest mammal (bumblebee bat)
Capital: Bangkok

Asia.name: Turkey
hints: Istanbul is the only city spanning two continents
Ancient site of Troy is located here
Capital: Ankara

Asia.name: Turkmenistan
hints: The Darvaza Gas Crater has burned since 1971
Declared permanent neutrality in the UN
Capital: Ashgabat

Asia.name: United Arab Emirates
hints: Home to the Burj Khalifa, the tallest building
Abu Dhabi holds 6% of global oil reserves
Capital: Abu Dhabi

Asia.name: Uzbekistan
hints: Samarkand was a key Silk Road city
Largest producer of cotton in Central Asia
Capital: Tashkent

Asia.name: Vietnam
hints: World’s second-largest coffee exporter
Ha Long Bay has over 1,600 limestone islands
Capital: Hanoi

Asia.name: Yemen
hints: Mocha coffee originated from its port city Al Mokha

Africa.name: Algeria
hints: Home to the Sahara Desert, covering 85% of its territory
The ancient Roman city of Timgad has perfectly preserved grid architecture
Capital: Algiers

Africa.name: Angola
hints: Kalandula Falls are Africa's second-largest waterfalls by volume
Currency features a dagger-toothed antelope (Giant Sable Antelope)
Capital: Luanda

Africa.name: Benin
hints: Birthplace of Vodun (Voodoo) religion
The floating village of Ganvié is called 'Venice of Africa'

Africa.name: Botswana
hints: World's largest diamond producer by value
Okavango Delta transforms into a wildlife-rich wetland annually
Capital: Gaborone

Africa.name: Burkina Faso
hints: Name means 'Land of Honest People' in local languages
Hosts the International Art and Craft Fair (SIAO)

Africa.name: Burundi
hints: One of the few countries with a traditional drumming ritual as UNESCO heritage

Africa.name: Cabo Verde
hints: Archipelago formed by volcanic activity
Cesária Évora, the 'Barefoot Diva', popularized morna music globally

Africa.name: Cameroon
hints: Known as 'Africa in Miniature' for its geographical diversity

Africa.name: Central African Republic
hints: Contains the Dzanga-Sangha rainforest, a gorilla sanctuary

Africa.name: Chad
hints: Lake Chad has shrunk by 90% since the 1960s
Toubou nomads traverse the Tibesti Mountains

Africa.name: Comoros
hints: Volcanic archipelago producing ylang-ylang perfume essence

Africa.name: Cote Divoire
hints: World's largest cocoa producer
Traditional Zaouli mask dance is UNESCO-protected

Africa.name: Democratic Republic Of The Congo
hints: Contains the Congo River (deepest in the world)
Home to critically endangered mountain gorillas

Africa.name: Djibouti
hints: Strategic location hosts foreign military bases
Lake Assal is Africa's lowest point and saltiest lake

Africa.name: Egypt
hints: Home to the only remaining Wonder of the Ancient World (Giza Pyramids)
Suez Canal shortens Europe-Asia travel by 7,000 km

hints: Only African country with Spanish as an official language

Africa.name: Eritrea

hints: Africa's last absolute monarchy

hints: Only African country never colonized

Africa.name: Gabon
hints: Over 80% rainforest cover with low deforestation
Mandrill monkeys thrive in Loango National Park

Africa.name: Gambia
hints: Smallest mainland African country
River Gambia flows entirely through its territory

Africa.name: Ghana
hints: First sub-Saharan country to gain independence (1957)
Kente cloth patterns symbolize cultural heritage
Capital: Accra

Africa.name: Guinea
hints: Source of the Niger, Senegal, and Gambia rivers
Simandou Range holds world's largest untapped iron ore reserves

hints: Bijagós Islands are a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve

hints: Great Migration sees 1.5 million wildebeest cross the Mara River
Invented mobile money transfer (M-Pesa)

Traditional Basotho blanket is a cultural icon

hints: Founded by freed American slaves in 1847

hints: Over 90% desert with the Sahara's hottest recorded temperature

hints: Lake Malawi contains more fish species than any other lake

hints: Timbuktu's ancient manuscripts are UNESCO-protected

hints: Sahara covers 90% of its land
Ancient Chinguetti is a UNESCO 'librarian city'

Africa.name: Morocco
hints: Only African country with both Atlantic and Mediterranean coastlines
Chefchaouen's blue-painted streets attract photographers

hints: Island of Mozambique is a UNESCO World Heritage Site

hints: Namib Desert has 1,000-year-old dunes
Largest free-roaming cheetah population

Africa.name: Niger
hints: Named after the Niger River (though most territory is desert)
Traditional Tuareg blue clothing protects against sun

hints: Africa's largest economy and population
Nollywood produces more films than Hollywood

hints: Often called Congo-Brazzaville to distinguish from DRC

Capital: Brazzaville

hints: Mountain gorillas thrive in Volcanoes National Park

hints: Dakar hosts the Monument of African Renaissance

hints: Name means 'Lion Mountains' from Portuguese explorers

hints: Longest coastline in mainland Africa

Africa.name: South Africa

Capital: Pretoria (administrative)

hints: Youngest country globally (independence in 2011)
Sudd swamp is one of Africa's largest wetlands

hints: More pyramids than Egypt (over 200)
Meroë was an ancient iron production hub
Capital: Khartoum

hints: Home to Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak
Serengeti hosts the Great Migration

hints: Name means 'behind the sea' in Ewe language
Fetish markets sell traditional healing items

hints: Ancient Carthage rivaled Rome

hints: Source of the Nile River at Jinja

hints: Victoria Falls ('Mosi-oa-Tunya') borders Zimbabwe
Walking safaris originated here

hints: Great Zimbabwe ruins inspired the country's name

hints: Largely uninhabited desert territory

America.name: Argentina
hints: Home to the southernmost city in the world (Ushuaia)

hints: Consists of over 700 islands and 2,000 cays

hints: Only Central American country with English as the official language

hints: Contains 60% of the Amazon Rainforest

America.name: Canada
hints: Longest coastline in the world (202,080 km)

hints: Atacama Desert is the driest non-polar place on Earth

hints: Generates 99% of its electricity from renewable sources

hints: Largest island in the Caribbean

America.name: Uruguay
hints: First country to legalize cannabis globally (2013)
Punta del Este hosts giant hand sculpture 'La Mano'
Capital: Montevideo

America.name: Venezuela
hints: Angel Falls is the world's highest uninterrupted waterfall
Oil reserves exceed Saudi Arabia's
Capital: Caracas

Others.name: Antigua and Barbuda
hints: Boasts 365 beaches—one for each day of the year
Hosts Antigua Sailing Week, a premier regatta event
Capital: Saint John's

Others.name: Australia
hints: Home to the Great Barrier Reef, visible from space
The only continent with no active volcanoes
Capital: Canberra

Others.name: Fiji
hints: One of the first countries to welcome the New Year due to its time zone
Traditional kava ceremonies are central to Fijian culture
Capital: Suva

Others.name: Nauru
hints: World's smallest island nation (21 km²)
Once had the highest GDP per capita due to phosphate mining
Capital: Yaren (de facto)

Others.name: New Zealand
hints: First country to grant women voting rights (1893)
Middle-earth in *The Lord of the Rings* was filmed here
Capital: Wellington

Others.name: Papua New Guinea
hints: Over 850 indigenous languages are spoken
Home to the world’s largest butterfly (Queen Alexandra’s birdwing)
Capital: Port Moresby

Others.name: Samoa
hints: Skipped a day in 2011 to align with Asia-Pacific time zones
Traditional *tatau* tattoos symbolize cultural identity
Capital: Apia

Others.name: Vanuatu
hints: Land diving (naghol) here inspired modern bungee jumping
One of the world’s most volcanic countries with 9 active volcanoes
Capital: Port Vila
